# The `CastInst` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

This is the base class for all instructions that perform data casts. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>class llvm::CastInst</CodeBlock>

## Description {#details}

This is the base class for all instructions that perform data casts.

It is simply provided so that instruction category testing can be performed with code like:

if (isa&lt;CastInst&gt;(Instr)) &#123; ... &#125; Base class of casting instructions.

Definition at line 444 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/instrtypes-h">InstrTypes.h</a>.

### isIntegerCast() {#aeb1b55a34e106493b57164146f40623b}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool CastInst::isIntegerCast () const">
There are several places where we need to know if a cast instruction only deals with integer source and destination types.

To simplify that logic, this method is provided. 
<SectionUser title="Returns">
true iff the cast has only integral typed operand and dest type. Determine if this is an integer-only cast.
</SectionUser>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/instrtypes-h/#l00569">569</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/instrtypes-h">InstrTypes.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/instructions-cpp/#l02696">2696</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/instructions-cpp">Instructions.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

Determine if this cast is a no-op cast.

<ParametersList title="Parameters">

## Public Static Functions

### castIsValid() {#af0e9f16b79d49af44209f202b31290a1}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool CastInst::castIsValid (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction/#afa0b2fa29ba074f2b6ec9ac11163f2d9">Instruction::CastOps</a> op, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; SrcTy, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; DstTy)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
This method can be used to determine if a cast from SrcTy to DstTy using Opcode op is valid or not.

<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/check">Check</a> that the construction parameters for a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/castinst">CastInst</a> are correct.


<SectionUser title="Returns">
true iff the proposed cast is valid. Determine if a cast is valid without creating one.
</SectionUser>

This could be broken out into the separate constructors but it is useful to have it in one place and to eliminate the redundant code for getting the sizes of the types involved.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/instrtypes-h/#l00621">621</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/instrtypes-h">InstrTypes.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/instructions-cpp/#l03241">3241</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/instructions-cpp">Instructions.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### Create() {#ad2e0ab6d7096fe67a2216fe349044387}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>CastInst &#42; CastInst::Create (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction/#afa0b2fa29ba074f2b6ec9ac11163f2d9">Instruction::CastOps</a> op, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; S, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; Ty, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a> &amp; Name=&quot;&quot;, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/insertposition">InsertPosition</a> InsertBefore=nullptr)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Provides a way to construct any of the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/castinst">CastInst</a> subclasses using an opcode instead of the subclass&#39;s constructor.

The opcode must be in the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction/#afa0b2fa29ba074f2b6ec9ac11163f2d9">CastOps</a> category (Instruction::isCast(opcode) returns true). This constructor has insert-before-instruction semantics to automatically insert the new <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/castinst">CastInst</a> before InsertBefore (if it is non-null). Construct any of the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/castinst">CastInst</a> subclasses

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/instrtypes-h/#l00460">460</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/instrtypes-h">InstrTypes.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/instructions-cpp/#l02972">2972</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/instructions-cpp">Instructions.cpp</a>.

### CreateBitOrPointerCast() {#acdb02479a44bbebcabf8b7b5e1baa921}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>CastInst &#42; CastInst::CreateBitOrPointerCast (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; S, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; Ty, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a> &amp; Name=&quot;&quot;, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/insertposition">InsertPosition</a> InsertBefore=nullptr)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Create a BitCast, a PtrToInt, or an IntToPTr cast instruction.

If the value is a pointer type and the destination an integer type, creates a PtrToInt cast. If the value is an integer type and the destination a pointer type, creates an IntToPtr cast. Otherwise, creates a bitcast.

### isEliminableCastPair() {#a8b805c54dc1ead67b711a4b1cb72f492}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>unsigned CastInst::isEliminableCastPair (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction/#afa0b2fa29ba074f2b6ec9ac11163f2d9">Instruction::CastOps</a> firstOp, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction/#afa0b2fa29ba074f2b6ec9ac11163f2d9">Instruction::CastOps</a> secondOp, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; SrcTy, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; MidTy, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; DstTy, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; SrcIntPtrTy, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; MidIntPtrTy, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; DstIntPtrTy)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Determine how a pair of casts can be eliminated, if they can be at all.

This function determines if a pair of casts can be eliminated and what opcode should be used in the elimination.

This is a helper function for both <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/castinst">CastInst</a> and <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantexpr">ConstantExpr</a>. 
<SectionUser title="Returns">
0 if the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/castinst">CastInst</a> pair can&#39;t be eliminated, otherwise returns <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction/#afa0b2fa29ba074f2b6ec9ac11163f2d9">Instruction::CastOps</a> value for a cast that can replace the pair, casting SrcTy to DstTy. Determine if a cast pair is eliminable
</SectionUser>

This assumes that there are two instructions like this:
<ul>
<li>F = firstOpcode SrcTy x to MidTy</li>
<li>S = secondOpcode MidTy F to DstTy The function returns a resultOpcode so these two casts can be replaced with:</li>
<li>Replacement = resultOpcode SrcTy x to DstTy If no such cast is permitted, the function returns 0.</li>
</ul>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/instrtypes-h/#l00596">596</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/instrtypes-h">InstrTypes.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/instructions-cpp/#l02759">2759</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/instructions-cpp">Instructions.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### isNoopCast() {#ace4c7b4bc6aba9506b1b60aac18881f3}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool CastInst::isNoopCast (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction/#afa0b2fa29ba074f2b6ec9ac11163f2d9">Instruction::CastOps</a> Opcode, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; SrcTy, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; DestTy, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/datalayout">DataLayout</a> &amp; DL)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
A no-op cast is one that can be effected without changing any bits.

This function determines if the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/castinst">CastInst</a> does not require any bits to be changed in order to effect the cast.

It implies that the source and destination types are the same size. The <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/datalayout">DataLayout</a> argument is to determine the pointer size when examining casts involving Integer and Pointer types. They are no-op casts if the integer is the same size as the pointer. However, pointer size varies with platform. Note that a precondition of this method is that the cast is legal - i.e. the instruction formed with these operands would verify.

Essentially, it identifies cases where no code gen is necessary for the cast, hence the name no-op cast. For example, the following are all no-op casts: 

<Link id="details" />



<Link id="details" />



<Link id="details" />



Determine if the described cast is a no-op.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/instrtypes-h/#l00578">578</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/instrtypes-h">InstrTypes.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/instructions-cpp/#l02717">2717</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/instructions-cpp">Instructions.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>
